Title: Stereopsidales - A New Order of Mushroom-Forming Fungi
Abstract:
One new order, one new family, and one new combination are
presented, as the result of molecular phylogenetic analyses. The new
order Stereopsidales and the new family Stereopsidaceae are described
incorporating Stereopsis radicans and Stereopsis globosum, formerly
Clavulicium globosum. We show that not only do these species represent
an old overlooked lineage, but both species harbour cryptic diversity.
In addition, a third species, Clavulicium macounii, appears as a
plausible sister to the new lineage, but there is conflict in the data.
All specimens of Stereopsis radicans and Stereopsis globosum analysed
here are from the South and Central Americas, several records of
Stereopsis radicans have been made also from tropical Asia. We expect
the true diversity in this group to be a lot higher than presented in
this paper. Stereopsis radicans was formerly included in Polyporales,
but a placement within that order is rejected by our data through SH
tests. The dataset consisted of four nuclear markers: rpb2, tef1, LSU
and SSU, each of which was analysed separately using maximum likelihood
and Bayesian analysis. Recombination detection tests indicate no
plausible recombinations. The potential of Stereopsis radicans,
Stereopsis globosum and Clavulicium macounii being amphitallic is
briefly discussed.
